intro: Famatina maulensis, commonly known as the Argentine nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its erect growth habit and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple. Its berries are toxic and contain alkaloids, making it a plant with both ecological and medicinal significance. The species is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
